citation.article-title: Bacteroides chinchillae sp. nov. and Bacteroides rodentium sp. nov., isolated from chinchilla (Chinchilla lanigera) faeces
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacteroides rodentium sp. nov.
Bacteroides rodentium [ro.den′ti.um. N.L. pl. gen. n. rodentium (from L. part. adj. rodens -entis, gnawing) of rodents, of gnawing animals].
Cells on EG agar are strictly anaerobic, non-spore-forming, non-motile, Gram-negative short rods or rods (0.8–2.0 µm wide and variable in length, mostly 1–4 µm).
Colonies on EG blood agar are 0.5–2.0 mm in diameter, disc-shaped and white-greyish and translucent.
Optimum temperature for growth is about 37 °C.
Grows in the presence of bile.

Produces acid from l-arabinose, cellobiose, glucose, lactose, maltose, d-mannose, raffinose, salicin, sucrose and d-xylose, but not from glycerol, d-mannitol, melezitose, l-rhamnose d-sorbitol or trehalose.
Aesculin is hydrolysed, but not gelatin.
Indole, catalase and urease are not produced.

With Rapid ID 32A, positive for α- and β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, α-arabinosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, alkaline phosphatase, leucyl glycine arylamidase, alanine arylamidase, glutamyl glutamic acid arylamidase and glutamic acid decarboxylase, but negative for urease, arginine dihydrolase, β-galactosidase-6-phosphate, β-glucuronidase, arginine arylamidase, proline arylamidase, phenylalanine arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, pyroglutamic acid arylamidase, tyrosine arylamidase, glycine arylamidase, histidine arylamidase, serine arylamidase and α-fucosidase.
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, C16 : 0, C18 : 1ω9c, C16 : 0 3-OH and iso-C15 : 0.
The G+C content of the type strain is 41.0 %.
The type strain is ST28T ( = JCM 16496T = CCUG 59334T), isolated from faeces of a chinchilla.
